text: President Trump's nominee tells senators on the Judiciary Commitee, "You would not be getting Justice Scalia, you would be getting Justice Barrett."

Senate Judiciary Committee Democrats pressed Amy Coney Barrett about her criticism of the legal opinion that saved Obamacare. But she noted that case differs from the one before the court on Nov. 10.

notes: The Supreme Court nominee discussed voting laws, rights and practices with her Democratic questioners on her third day of confirmation hearings before the Senate Judiciary Committee.
Resuming Shortly: Amy Coney Barrett's Supreme Court Confirmation Hearing

text: Democrats continue to press Barrett on health care and voting rights in particular. Barrett is steadfastly refusing to share her personal views, in the tradition of Supreme Court nominees before her.
